org.jmotif.algorithm

Class MatrixFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jmotif.algorithm.MatrixFactory

  • public final class MatrixFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements methods for matrix data generation and transformation.
    Author:
    Pavel Senin

      • zeros

        public static double[][] zeros(int m)
        Creates a single row matrix of doubles filled by zeroes.
        Parameters:
        m - the desired number of columns.
        Returns:
        the single row matrix of m columns.

      • zeros

        public static double[][] zeros(int n,
                               int m)
        Creates matrix of size n (rows) x m (columns) filled by zeroes.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of rows.
        m - the number of columns.
        Returns:
        the nxm matrix of zeroes.

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(double[][] a,
                             double[][] b)
        Compare two matrices by elements.
        Parameters:
        a - the first matrix.
        b - the second matrix.
        Returns:
        true if matrices are equal, false in the case where at least one element is not equal, or matrices are of different dimensions.

      • clone

        public static double[][] clone(double[][] a)
        Clone the matrix.
        Parameters:
        a - the matrix to duplicate.
        Returns:
        the copy (a new instance) of the input matrix.

      • transpose

        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] a)
        Perform the matrix transposition.
        Parameters:
        a - an input matrix.
        Returns:
        an instance of transposed matrix.

      • reshape

        public static double[][] reshape(double[][] a,
                                 int n,
                                 int m)
        Mimics Matlab function for reshape: returns the m-by-n matrix B whose elements are taken column-wise from A. An error results if A does not have m*n elements.
        Parameters:
        a - the source matrix.
        n - number of rows in the new matrix.
        m - number of columns in the new matrix.
        Returns:
        reshaped matrix.

      • colMeans

        public static double[] colMeans(double[][] a)
        Computes column means for the matrix.
        Parameters:
        a - the input matrix.
        Returns:
        result.

        public static java.lang.String toString(double[][] a)
        Prints out matrix.
        Parameters:
        a - the matrix to print.
        Returns:
        ready for console output string.

        public static java.lang.String toCodeString(double[][] a)

        Returns:
